meanings.definition: To move in a crowded, confused mass.
meanings.sent1: The children hotch together in the playground during recess.
meanings.sent2: The fans hotch towards the stage to get a better view of the concert.
meanings.sent3: The puppies hotch around the food bowl, eager to eat.
meanings.sent4: The ants hotch in a line, carrying food back to their nest.
meanings.sent5: The commuters hotch onto the train during rush hour, trying to find a seat.

meanings.sent1: The desk was a hotch of papers, pens, and books.
meanings.sent2: The attic was a hotch of old furniture and boxes.
meanings.sent3: The party turned into a hotch of laughter and music.
meanings.sent4: The garden shed was a hotch of gardening tools and pots.
meanings.sent5: The closet was a hotch of clothes, shoes, and accessories.
